title: Demi Moore co-star claims to be the man she cheated with before wedding
text:
Paul claims to be Demi’s mystery man

Demi Moore’s mystery lover has come forward with a former co-star claiming to be the man she slept with the night before her first wedding.

In her new memoir Inside Out, the Ghost actress admits to cheating with another man just hours before she tied the knot with first husband, Freddy Moore, in February 1981.

The 56-year-old actress didn’t reveal the man’s identity but her former co-star Paul Carafotes, claims he is the man she shared a night of passion with.

Recalling their sexual encounter in an interview with the Daily Mail TV, Paul claims Demi climbed through his kitchen window to enjoy ‘one last hurrah’.

The Mindhunter actor said: ‘I think she just wanted to have a last hurrah before she got married.

‘She was an 18-year-old pretty girl and we were in Hollywood filming a movie and partying together.

‘We were young, we were having a good time, nobody gives you a book which says this is how to behave. But I certainly didn’t think she’d climb that fire escape.’

Demi and Paul starred together in the 1981 movie Choices (Picture: Dailymotion)

According to the 60-year-old actor, it was Demi who made the first move by ringing him after he’d worked an 18-hour work day, saying she wanted to visit him.

‘And I just said, “Ah you know, that’s probably not a great thing to do right now. I’m tired. I’m in bed”. I hang up the phone and she called again, she was persistent,’ Paul claimed.

Demi and Paul have starred together in the 1981 movie Choices, while he is also best known for appearing alongside Brad Pitt in Fight Club.

Demi married first husband Freddy Moore in 1980 (Picture: Getty Images)

Sharing his thoughts as to why Demi wanted one-night-stand, Paul explained: ‘I think she just wanted to have a last hurrah before she got married.

‘She wanted to have some fun, she was young, she was a kid. Maybe she wanted a last throw down and then she was going to be the good Catholic girl, I don’t know.’

Demi admitted to cheating on Roger and recalls ‘sneaking out of her bachelorette party to visit his apartment’.

‘The night before we got married, instead of working on my vows, I was calling a guy I’d met on a movie set,’ she writes in her new book.

‘Why did I do that?” Moore – whose father Danny Guynes committed suicide months earlier in October 1980 – wrote.

‘Why didn’t I go and see the man I was committing to spend the rest of my life with to express my doubts? Because I couldn’t face the fact that I was getting married to distract myself from grieving the death of my father.

She added: ‘Because I felt there was no room to question what I’d already put in motion. I couldn’t get out of the marriage, but I could sabotage it.’
